lines.text: You know I'm very much in love with you, don't you?
Are you?
I'm crazy about you, and you know it.
I didn't know.
Well, you know it now.
What about it?
[She takes a drink]
That's it... what? Are you going to make me stand around on ceremony?
Think I'm so old-fashioned?
I hope not.
You're right. I'm not. I believe in... trying love out.
On approval?
Yes, on approval.
[They kiss as the scene fade out]
The auction's on full wing... going, going, gawne!
It's a tough break being left stranded like this. Why, we're paupers!

[She giggles]
Well, there's no use crying about it. Buck up! Put on your spurs and get up and give the world a battle.
[She pushes his head affectionately]
Swat 'em in the head.
Yeah? Just how?
Go to work. I'm not afraid.
You afraid?
[Sarcastically]
What could you do?... open up a tea shoppie? Bonnie Jordan's orange pekoe blend! Go to it!

[after Bonnie and her friends have stripped and jumped into the water]
Oh, you little minx! Sometimes I'm sorry you're too old to spank!

[Obviously taken with Bonnie]
You got me going, sister.
Can I depend on it?
In a big way.
Must you smoke before breakfast?
I must if I want to keep thin, darling.

[Advising Bonnie on being a reporter]
You'll learn, Kid... cleanliness... condensation... where, what, when, and why... that's the idea. Say, don't let those guys on the copy desk bother yuh. They're just a bunch of butchers at heart. Why, do you know what they'd do if they got a chance?
What?
They'd cut the Lord's Prayer down to a one line squib.

[to Rodney]
No, listen, Kid. Money talks, but remember - in this business it's the only thing that talks.
What's the matter? You've kissed me before, haven't you?
Yes, but that wasn't a permanent arrangement, was it?
Aren't you being clever!
And aren't you being vague as usual?

All right, if that's what you want, I'll set you up in a real establishment anytime you like. You don't have to make your living off of Jake Luva, dancing in his nightclub. I can do much better for you than that. Now is that less vague?

That's very clear. Now we understand each other. I'm a cheap little dancer in a night club, and you thought you could have me on your own terms. Well, you're mistaken! I can still pick my own men, Mr. Townsend, and right now it's Jake Luva.

[to Bob]
Don't touch me. That's all over with. Nice of you to be so generous, but I must be going. I have a heavy date tonight.
[Pausing at the door as she's leaving]
I'm hitting the pace now, and I like it.
